description.narrative: Help improve the access to and the utilization of basic infrastructure and services for the Project's targeted poor communities. The PDO would be achieved through inclusive community and local development processes with emphasis on ensuring sustainability.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA: Schedule II, Section I.A, para 4 | Description :Within nine (9) months of the Effective Date amend theProject Entity's Legislation to reflect the revised institutional arrangements of the PRF. | Due Date :06-Jul-2012

Finance Agreement :FA: Schedule II, Section II.A, para 1(a); and PA: Schedule, Section II.A, para 1 | Description :PIE to preparesemi-annual Project Reports and furnish them to the Recipient and IDA not later than 2 months after end of the period covered bysuch report. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA: Schedule II, Section II.B, para 2; and PA: Schedule, Section II.B, para 2 | Description :PIE to prepare andfurnish to IDA not later than 45 days after the end of each calendar quarter, interim unaudited financial reports covering thequarter. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement (PA): Schedule, Section II.B, para 3 | Description :PIE shall have its financial statementsfor each fiscal year audited by independent auditors and furnish them to IDA not later than6 months after end of such period. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I, Schedule 1 to the IDA & MDTF Project Agreements | Description :Obligation of the Recipient to makeavailable to PRF the proceeds of the IDA and MDTF financing under a Subsidiary Grant Agreement on terms and conditions acceptableto the IDA

Finance Agreement :Section I, Schedule 2 (IDA FA & MDTF GA), Section I, Schedule 1 (IDA & MDTF PA) | Description :Obligation of theRecipient/PRF to ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the Project Operational Manual.

Finance Agreement :Section I, Schedule 2 (IDA FA, MDTF GA), Section I, Schedule 1 (IDA & MDTF PA) | Description :Obligation of theRecipient/PRF to ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the ESMF and all safeguard provisions of the legalagreement, including the preparation and implementation of all site-specific safeguard assessments and plans required under theESMF

Finance Agreement :Section I, Schedule 2 to the IDA FA & MDTF GA | Description :Obligation of the Recipient to make available toPRF the proceeds of the IDA and MDTF financing under a Subsidiary Grant Agreement on terms and conditions acceptable to the IDA |Due Date :01-Sep-2015

title.narrative: % of districts where district officials provide technical assistance and supervision to communities
Grievances registered related to delivery of project benefits addressed (%)
# of communities able to plan, implement and monitor their activities
x% of sub-project activities are of high technical quality
% PRF kum ban plans used by government and/or other development actors for planning and funding
Decision-making on allocation of PRF resources involve at least 40% women
Community contribution in the total project costs (%)
Sub-projects with post-project community engagement or O&M arrangements (%)
Greater than 75% satisfaction levels reported by beneficiaries in targeted villages regarding improved services and local development planning
Improved access to and utilization of basic economic and social services in kum bans supported by PRF (Text, Custom)

target.value: The supplementary school enrollment indicator has been dropped. The outcome is measured by level of satisfaction (PDO indicatorabove) and #/type of sub-project implemented (intermediate results indicator). End targets have been set for different types ofsub-projects: 6% point increase in access and utilization of health services; 8% point increase in access to and use of safe waterresources; 8% point increase in access to and use of roads.

title.narrative: % of HHs with access to all weather roads (percentage, Custom Supplement)
% of HHs with access to and utilization of health services (Percentage, Custom Supplement)
% of HHs with improved access to and utilization of safe water resources (Percentage, Custom Supplement)
Lowest two quintiles benefit from above services
Improvement in dietary diversity among pregnant/ lactating women and children aged 6-24 months
% of beneficiary communities that successfully achieved Open Defecation Free (ODF) status
No. and type of livelihood activities supported by seed grant
